results.headline: A Place, and Prescription, of One’s Own

results.headline: With Dad in Jail, a Family Carries on
results.summary_short: Michael Winterbottom’s family drama “Everyday” chronicles a working-class family in a Scottish village while the father is in prison.

results.headline: A Bird’s-Eye View of Liberation
results.summary_short: “Die Narbe” (“The Scar”) is an aerially photographed documentary about the Berlin Wall’s legacy.

results.headline: Love Among the Gas Pumps
results.summary_short: A gas station looms large in “Detroit Unleaded,” a soft-spoken Arab-American romantic comedy.

results.headline: Fatherhood, Supersized
results.summary_short: In “Delivery Man,” Vince Vaughn plays a sperm donor who learns he has sired more than 500 children.

results.headline: Home for the Dollar Days
results.summary_short: In “Cold Turkey,” the adult children returning for a family Thanksgiving all hope their father can give them some money.

results.headline: The Ultimate Pinup Queen, With a Peek at the Sad Side
results.summary_short: “Bettie Page Reveals All” a documentary from Mark Mori, uses a Page voice-over stitched together from audio interviews in presenting the legendary pinup girl’s not-all-happy story.

results.headline: The Glory of Rome, the Sweetness of Life
results.summary_short: In “The Great Beauty,” a sybaritic writer, now 65, considers the essence of Rome and his place in it.

results.headline: You May Already Be a Winner. Or Not.
results.summary_short: “Nebraska,” Alexander Payne’s fourth film set at least partly in his home state, stars Bruce Dern, Will Forte and June Squibb in a comedy that gets under a cantankerous older man’s skin.

results.headline: Airlifting Big Cats From Circus Hell
results.summary_short: The documentary “Lion Ark” follows a team of rescuers as they track down lions exploited in Bolivian shows.

results.headline: The Muse of Goethe, Intensified
results.summary_short: “Faust,” the concluding installment of the “Men of Power” tetralogy, is Alexander Sokurov’s freehanded adaptation of Goethe’s great allegorical drama.

results.headline: Long Shadow of an All-Powerful Neighbor
results.summary_short: “The Great Fallacy” turns an analytical lens on the United States relationship with Puerto Rico and Puerto Ricans.

results.headline: Millennials With Boomer Angst
results.summary_short: With its reunion theme, “The Fall of 1980” revisits the theme of youthful idealism diminished by middle-age cares.

results.headline: Reuniting as Grown-Ups, Kind Of
results.summary_short: Long-forgotten rivalries and attractions simmer in “The Best Man Holiday,” about onetime college friends reuniting in their late 30s.

results.headline: High Price of Barely Getting By
results.summary_short: In Laurie Collyer’s “Sunlight Jr.,” Naomi Watts and Matt Dillon play unmarried lovers with no way out of the minimum-wage working class.

results.headline: A Rampage With No Rhyme or Reason
results.summary_short: The documentary “Long Island Railroad Massacre” returns to the 1993 killings aboard a commuter train and catches up with those affected.

results.headline: Hazily Hoping for an Easy Hit
results.summary_short: In “Junction,” a group of four addicts attempt what they hope will be an easy, impromptu robbery. Oops.

results.headline: Closeted High School Romances
results.summary_short: In “Geography Club,” high school students form a front organization for what is really a gay support group.
